website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a challenging game that will keep kids and adults on their edge of their seats, this is the one to pick. You may remember it from your childhood – it's just as fun today.
pros: The classic skill game that keeps players on edge as they attempt to "operate" without setting off the buzzer
Exciting and challenging fun for kids and adults
cons: A bit too difficult for young kids to master – takes a steady hand and focused concentration
A few reports of missing pieces upon arrival

customer_reviews.title: dirty game, even dirty pieces of who knows what ...
customer_reviews.text: So disrespectful! Broken box, missing parts, dirty game, even dirty pieces of who knows what inside!! It was a “Santa Claus” gift! How embarrassing! Argggghhhhg SO UPSET!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Maybe my childhood was just so flippin' awesome that I didn't notice this game was actually like ...
customer_reviews.text: It is so lite in weight that you can't play it without securing it to the table. It used to be a loud and obnoxious game, but now the buzz is so underwhelming you barely flinch. When you do touch the edges the buzz starts real slow and hardly revs up. Maybe my childhood was just so flippin' awesome that I didn't notice this game was actually like that when I was a kid, but I don't think so.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Meidam

customer_reviews.title: Good, clean version of the game.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 4 & 6 year old girls to replace another version of Operation that is inappropriately gross for kids. They like the challenge and are entertained. I like that it is clean and helps to develop their fine motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: Vicvic

customer_reviews.title: FUN!
customer_reviews.text: This game is one I used to play as a Child now my Husband & I still love playing it... I love the fact that all pieces were in it & that it works... playing right now with him.... I don't like losing though lol!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha M.

customer_reviews.title: Total disappointment - the buzzer doesn't even work anymore, which makes this really lame...
customer_reviews.text: "Back in my day" we played operation and if we touched the side we literally jumped in the air because the buzzer was so loud and intense... With this in mind I thought it'd be a great game to play with the 8 year old. However, when we got the game I touched the metal and was met with a very quiet "buzz" that needed to "rev" up before it was actually a "buzz"... The version I remember playing would buzz the second you touched the metal - this version is totally lame. Avoid at all costs and make Amazon fix their stupid "Amazon Exclusive" version.
customer_reviews.author: Design Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Batteries not included!!!!!! Needs AA batteries
customer_reviews.text: Batteries aren't included if you can read definitely do so because it clearly says it in their description, but anyway it came in such good condition,it was wrapped up nicely, the money and cards were also wrapped up nicely, I have no clue what the people in the reviews are talking about that it was a mess,nope straight up lies.Everything is just great but the buzzer isn't that loud unless if you hold it on the metal thing for too long.
customer_reviews.author: Kitten

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: First of all there is no buzzer sound. It just vibrates and the nose lights up. There's no sound. Problem is because they are using a Vibration it shakes all the pieces and they slide under the space some vanishing from site all together. The board is flimsy and bows if you put any pressure on it. Young kids might not care but it doesn't work the same as the classic and is very flimsy obviously to cut cost and increase profit. It required 2AA Batteries not included and you need a very SMALL screw driver to get the battery cover off to install them.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. CT

customer_reviews.title: I liked it, however the buzzer in mine doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I received the one pictured her - with the "Brain Freeze" item. I liked it, however the buzzer in mine doesn't work. So although I really dig the fact that this is as "old school" cool and fun as I remember from my childhood, I wish my buzzer worked. It'd be more "proof" to my little kids when they touch the sides, and have to "let the specialist take over"! All-in-all, it is a fun game, requires 2x AA batteries, and is a true "blast from your past" game.
customer_reviews.author: sipy

customer_reviews.title: Parts so tiny they disappear in the cavities
customer_reviews.text: The part pieces are so small they get lost in the cavities so you cant see them. There is no way you can get them out with the tweezers without the buzzer going off. I thought there was a version with larger parts. I returned this one. Dont waste your money. Even an adult cant do this version.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Collins

customer_reviews.title: OPERATION GAME LIKE THE OLD ONE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm totally thrilled that is found this original OPERATION GAME! It is complete with the anatomy parts of the game is played with in my youth, it has one extra body part, an ice cream cone for "brain freeze" but you cannot beat this version. The nose lights, the buzzer buzzes and there are Doctor and Specialists cards plus bank money. Thank you, the price was unbelievable, the delivery was so fast!
customer_reviews.author: B.S.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the original representation of it. The one that I’ve been looking for. Some people are complaining about brain freeze piece addition- why though? My kids loved it! The game arrived factory sealed, the cardboard is thick, the cards are made from nice and thick cardboard too. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Buttons

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: So happy to have the game like I played it as a child so my kids can experience it like I did! It was so much fun to see my kids playing it and being startled by that buzzer because they were concentrating, just like I was! Worth it for sure! I will say the brain freeze piece is way too easy to get out, the part you grip with the tweezers is way too big to make it difficult. Other than that I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Satine27

customer_reviews.title: They took out the buzzer!
customer_reviews.text: It's still the classic game, but they took out the beeping sound the buzzer makes. Instead it just vibrates, moving the pieces a bit each time. Still, I give it a 5 star because it has everything else down perfectly from when we were kids.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Game
customer_reviews.text: It was crushed when I got it and very cheeply made
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Bratcher

customer_reviews.title: Bones not included!! Furious!
customer_reviews.text: I do my Christmas shopping early starting in October, so the return window is now closed. My daughter unwrapped this this morning, it's Christmas today, and we were excited to play it. I took the plastic wrap and unboxed it myself as I would be inserting batteries and was shocked to find the bones were not included! No wonder it was on sale so cheap!!!! Amazon, you need to accept a return on this item and you need to inspect the items you represent for quality. Shame on you. I buy gifts for needy children as well and thank god I did not gift this to one of them!
customer_reviews.author: Cypress

customer_reviews.title: The box was smashed and had a hole in it.
customer_reviews.text: The box was badly damaged, but the game itself was playable, so I'm keeping it. ONLY because everyone is home from school for weeks because of the Coronavirus and board games are needed!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Korzon

customer_reviews.title: It’s just what you remember
customer_reviews.text: Game was wonderful as a gift to my daughter (6) for Christmas. Was just like when I was a kid. She freaked out laughing, cheating, demanding extra tries. So worth it. Get your kids things they can’t use without interaction with you and others better bang for the buck
customer_reviews.author: Sharief Bdour

customer_reviews.title: Too Hard
customer_reviews.text: I did not enjoy this game. Others might like the challenge but there is no way I can pick the items up without touching the sides. My grandchildren weren't too crazy about it either. But that is just us. Others might enjoy the mighty challenge of the game. So that is why I gave it at least 3 Stars. Good game, just not for us.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Jentz

customer_reviews.title: Fun But
customer_reviews.text: I had one many years ago and loved it as a kid. But I forgot how hard it is, plus they have made it harder to play I think.. They have made the tweezers rounded with a little knob on the end (safety? - silly) that makes it very hard to get them in the tiny slots, much less open them and grasp the items. Really need to make the slots bigger. We don't play it much because it is too hard and the kids lose interest fast. Our Grandkids, age 7 and 5 can't do it very well.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Literally, fun for the family!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grand twins as a gift. They didn't get near it as their aunts, uncles, and grands grabbed it and started playing. We are as bad at it as we always were...
customer_reviews.author: Аmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Woo Hoo - The Original Operation Game and New Too!
customer_reviews.text: My son, in college, asked for the "Operation" game for his on campus apartment so he and his friends could play. We wanted to get him the original game that I grew up with, however, our original game was a mess and missing parts from use long ago. We searched for the game but could only find the "Newer" operation game. Surprisingly, we found the original "Operation" game on Amazon and I thought we would receive a used one. To my surprise, the game arrived, brand new, in its plastic wrapping. Both my son and I were very pleased. The game plays as it should and everyone is happy! Reviewed by G. Swanson
customer_reviews.author: G. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Patient Dies Every Time
customer_reviews.text: Patient died with every procedure. Finally looked at the tweezers and noticed they were bent, so maybe I'm a good surgeon after all. I'm not sure if I'll re-purchase, though it seems like it would still be a fun game.
customer_reviews.author: fabulous55

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as the original by far!
customer_reviews.text: DONT GET YOUR HOPES UP!! Tongs that come with it are round tipped so makes it impossible to pick up anything even when you ignore the buzzer. The buzzer doesn’t make a sound, the game just vibrates.
customer_reviews.author: DeWanica P.

customer_reviews.title: The better version of Operation
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much the Operation I remember. Or at least as close as it's going to get. Avoid the other version with the horrible reviews. The only drawback to this game is that the board's "chambers" for the pieces are a bit too deep on the sides, so the pieces can hide almost out of sight. The walls should have been closer to the actual room needed for each piece.
customer_reviews.author: L-Knight

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description
customer_reviews.text: Misleading description, said it was the new addition and it's the classic. I paid more from this seller assuming it was the new addition.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Davis

customer_reviews.title: Still a great game
customer_reviews.text: I don’t remember the pieces looking so cheap, but I also remember being better at playing it!! Lol! It’s a great game, and harder than it looks, so didn’t go over so hot with the 6 year old I got it for. Probably better for older kids.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old granddaughter and I played Operation and she Loved It! what fun we had and she is able to practice coordination skills by moving the small objects. Good Fun for everyone. She also liked getting paid for her operationing skills. LOL She beat me good the very first time.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun Game For Family and Friends Classic
customer_reviews.text: We love this game Operation for years .We had to buy a new one .Thank you so much it was in perfect condition ,packaged well and fast delivery Very happy family😊Please be safe out there God Bless🙏
customer_reviews.author: Barbara G.

customer_reviews.title: One Of Our All-Time Favorites!!!!
customer_reviews.text: One of our all-time favorite board games!!!! I am happy I found it!!!! It arrived in excellent condition!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Classic game
customer_reviews.text: The game arrived smashed on one side but the board wasn’t injured. I had never played this game and bought it for my 7 year old granddaughter after hearing great reviews; she wants to be a doctor. It’s a bit harder than I expected- grabbing the items with tweezers is definitely an acquired skill. I expect the game will grow on us.
customer_reviews.author: Storytellersrus

customer_reviews.title: Very good game to develop grip and fine motor skills. Would ask to include spare body part sets, easy to lose them.
customer_reviews.text: Game is very good and teaches little hands how to get a grip (!), so to speak. Circuitry works great. Problem is the pieces are so small that you tend to lose them easily. I think the set comes with 15 pieces and within one week my son had lost more than half of them. The pieces are cheap plastic, why not just include a couple of spare sets with the game (wouldn't cost 10-20 cents more for the manufacturer to include spares). Would avoid a lot of tension for the parent and toddler!
customer_reviews.author: wiselyunwise

customer_reviews.title: Great for fine motor skills
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game to add to our collection. I played with my 4 year old and he loved it. He’s a little young for it but he was very interested! This game is great for developing fine motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: It really is the Classic Version!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend. He is 24 years old and once he opened it- the look in his face was priceless! It brought back the kid in him! It was everything like the classic version of Operation!
customer_reviews.author: Ice1

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought this for game night. It brings back so much nostalgia. Yes it is still fun to play. I can't wait until my son is old enough to play it too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Original (or very close to it) version.
customer_reviews.text: This is as close to the original as I can remember. Kids love it. There are a few newer revisions out there which are not the same as this classic version.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Daugirda

customer_reviews.title: Such a Great Game
customer_reviews.text: Such a Classic. Kids love the game so much that they had me buying replacement pieces on Ebay, lol. No board game closet is complete without Operation.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Old School Classic game!!!
customer_reviews.text: One truly classic game that has tested the changes of time. Played with my son and he loves it. It's pretty challenging. Be careful, since pieces are very small it's easy to lose them. Worked perfectly and fun game!
customer_reviews.author: TopSella

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining
customer_reviews.text: Love the old school look and feel of this version. Hours of entertainment with my seven year old. However, my four year old is not a fan of the buzz when you touch the side. It’s a fun game.
customer_reviews.author: Real Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for Little Ones !!!
customer_reviews.text: This Game is a Classic and so much fun for little ones, ages 4-7 I think. Bought this for my 7- & 5-yr old grandsons for Christmas. It was a hit ! They like their Mom & Dad, Nanny & Papa to play it with them too ! Family Fun !
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Gore

customer_reviews.title: It's still so much fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for toddler.. she soon got jacked by her Dad and her sister. This game brings back so many memories. It's tougher than I remember! Especially the little Charlie horse!!! Man that little sucker is challenging! Get it it's so much fun. That's what my "toddler" says..
customer_reviews.author: SOPHIA M.

customer_reviews.title: Keep it old school
customer_reviews.text: Great family game and fun throwback for parents raised in the '80s. Looks just like the original
customer_reviews.author: Kay Dub

customer_reviews.title: Classic not so classic
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was gonna have the loud buzzer a little sad it doesn't and the green slimy peices I will miss you but hey change is good.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: This was more difficult then I remember as a kid, but lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: kmeyers

customer_reviews.title: Great game and perfect gift!
customer_reviews.text: This game is loved in our house! Looks like the original we had when we were kids. Easy to assemble. I would suggest to store the pieces in a zip lock bag. Perfect as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Lizio

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest...
customer_reviews.text: It is always so sad when you order something that you remember from your youth and then it comes and it seems so much less. Super cute but very flimsy etc... We did keep it and played it (once) but probably would not recommend. (sorry)
customer_reviews.author: Nashville066

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: The pieces are so cheap. I couldn’t even play with my grandson because the instrument used to pick up the pieces is short and cheaply made. Nothing like it was back in the day!
customer_reviews.author: Sai

customer_reviews.title: Cheesy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my great grandson and was very disappointed with the quality. It was not made well like the ones from years ago. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: virginialady

customer_reviews.title: fun game
customer_reviews.text: fun game, i'm terrible at it, but the nephews are great at it.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine C.

customer_reviews.title: Not just for  kids.
customer_reviews.text: My Husband and I saw this game and had to get it. We really enjoyed playing it . It brought back memories. Its not as easy as it looks. I highly recommend those adults young at heart.
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha Clinton

customer_reviews.title: Missing piece and bent cards
customer_reviews.text: Bought this "oldie but goodie" game. It is missing a piece and card was bent....it did come with batteries already though. :) Need to call Hasbro to see if we can order the missing piece.
customer_reviews.author: WillyWonka

customer_reviews.title: Operation is fun for the entire family.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful gift for families. Children and adults love to play. Laughs from all.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good game for children to play
customer_reviews.text: A game with several small pieces but the children love to place them in the appropriate body position. And they squeal with delight if they touch the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Terry B

customer_reviews.title: Not what it was.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the way it was when I was a kid. It used to be obnoxious and would scare the crap out of you when you played. Also the pieces are cheap and not shaped the same. They’re harder to get out in a weird way. It does the same stuff but it just vibrates. It doesn’t rattle your bones and buzz your nerves anymore. Takes the real fun out of it now.
customer_reviews.author: BMH

customer_reviews.title: Still fun, but not the scared to death when the ...
customer_reviews.text: Same game as original BUT the nose buzzer isn't as loud. Still fun, but not the scared to death when the buzzer goes off sound
customer_reviews.author: Adventure Mom

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my grandchildren. We just opened it today. It doesn’t work. The buzzer doesn’t work at all. It was missing a part, as well. We were all very disappointed! It was a waste of money, and I can’t return it. Julie
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: Being on a tight budget I bought this one game for my 2 nieces and 1 nephew. They love it !! I made me happy to hear they all enjoy playing the game so much
customer_reviews.author: jack small

customer_reviews.title: Charlie Horse is IMPOSSIBLE (even for adults)
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to play with our child to work on her fine motor skills. The pieces are so difficult to remove that she lost interest and my husband and I spent a considerably long time trying to remove the Charlie Horse. It is IMPOSSIBLE. We couldn’t even remove it while ignoring the buzzing sound. Definitely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: ilyssa

customer_reviews.title: a peice was made the opposite way
customer_reviews.text: When places it is impossible to pull up because it is facing down on the slick side.
customer_reviews.author: Mendkidz

customer_reviews.title: just like i remembered from my childhood in the early 80s
customer_reviews.text: game arrived shrink wrapped as if I purchased it in person from a toy store. all game pieces were still in individual packaging and nothing appeared broken.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: This is great. My 7yr old loves it and it doesn’t make that super loud buzz noise and create anxiety or wake my babies. It a soft noise and vibration.
customer_reviews.author: Kryzzle

customer_reviews.title: Worked 2 times and broke!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this game to my grandaughter for Christmas she loved to play the version that was for smaller children. She came over today to play and wanted to play the game and it would not work. The BASE will not stay down so it will not pop up! DISAPPOINTED RED HEADED 5 year old!
customer_reviews.author: Marsha  Martin

customer_reviews.title: It takes a Very Steady Hand!
customer_reviews.text: This game never gets old. I have fond memories from 40 years ago playing this in my grandparent's basement. Granted it was a simpler time without the modern electronics that kids have now, but its still a lot of fun to play. Bought this for my nephew who lives out of state and couldn't stop laughing at the kid's reactions when they accidentally caused the buzzer to go off!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Lange

customer_reviews.title: classic game
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have classic game! My mom wanted to old classic version over the new version and loves it! Had so much fun with it! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Aysenu

customer_reviews.title: Vibrates,no loud beep on mistake
customer_reviews.text: I really like that thid game vibrates instead not the old school beep noise that made you jump out of your seat. Although I do miss that, it is nice for when you're having family time but the baby is sleeping near by.
customer_reviews.author: shanni

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Misaligned pieces!
customer_reviews.text: Don't risk buying it. A few people are saying the same. In my case 8 body parts are misaligned. Imposible to play! What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Arturo & Diana

customer_reviews.title: Her happiness
customer_reviews.text: Birthday girl thursday and her gifts from grnadma are here. Thnak you amazon
customer_reviews.author: FRANCES RIVERA

customer_reviews.title: Colorful game
customer_reviews.text: Still fun! The younger children love this game. My grand daughter age 5 loves it. Play with your kids and watch their eyes light up .
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: ... teach my granddaughter some patience - she gets frustrated easily and this a game of patience and skill - ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this intentionally to teach my granddaughter some patience - she gets frustrated easily and this a game of patience and skill - great tool for teaching. Quality could be improved upon - doubt it will last as long as the one I had as a child but still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: An old school game but it’s still awesome I love the vibration and the flashing nose. It’s family and child friendly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to receive this game. However, we are unable to play because the board covering and spaces for the body parts are misaligned. For at least 3 of the body parts, we are not able to dig in and operate. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Reid

customer_reviews.title: Odd but nice
customer_reviews.text: It’s a fun game to play, kids love it, but it’s a bit odd to gift it bc there’s an undressed man on the lid....
customer_reviews.author: LogosPTO

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: Loved playing this when I was a kid. Bought it for my nieces and my massage therapist's kids. They all love it!
customer_reviews.author: karla schaerer

customer_reviews.title: Not Good for Teaching the Body Parts
customer_reviews.text: It would be a much better game if they use the actual name of the body parts.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Fun time
customer_reviews.text: It is good for kids who are learning to have patience. Good to practice motor skills. Good toy.
customer_reviews.author: cmaldonad

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t come complete
customer_reviews.text: Everything is good with this game except we didn’t receive the rubber band which part of the game kinda bummed game isn’t complete , we have a few rubber bands here but they didn’t fit
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Mae

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun!
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn’t love Operation? I remember playing it when I was a child and bought one for my son. He loves it. So much fun!
customer_reviews.author: G Ko

customer_reviews.title: Good old school board game
customer_reviews.text: Well pack and definitely the original. Can’t wait to play with my kids tonight.
customer_reviews.author: CenCen

customer_reviews.title: Family fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game to play with my nephew who is 4 years old. It was very engaging and helped with his fine motor skills. He always enjoys playing with us!
customer_reviews.author: Jawad Toor

customer_reviews.title: It works and it is a fun game
customer_reviews.text: It buzzes and the red nose lights up when the tweezer touches the edges, it's a fun game, had a great time playing.
customer_reviews.author: meluckycharmsnyc

customer_reviews.title: Flashback Fun...
customer_reviews.text: Great for all ages, perfect fun during these most unusual times.
customer_reviews.author: Hotelman

customer_reviews.title: As near as I can tell, this game has ...
customer_reviews.text: As near as I can tell, this game has not changed since I was a kid 40 years ago. If you've ever played with this, you will get what you are expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Hochstatter

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this game as a child, and now I get to share it with my son. The fun continues!
customer_reviews.author: Bdj

customer_reviews.title: What FUN!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game to play at my daughters nursing school grad party. Everyone had a blast playing it! Like that it is the classic version. I had no idea that there were 2 different versions until I started reading other reviews!
customer_reviews.author: redruby sue

customer_reviews.title: Has the actual "game" like cards and money but my kids don't play with ...
customer_reviews.text: Has the actual "game" like cards and money but my kids don't play with those at all, haha. It's the version I remember as a kid from the 80s. I don't like that the box has the Shrek/Minion version on the side since my son asks for that one all the time but from what I read, those are a disappointment to those of us who grew up with this game.
customer_reviews.author: Miss C

customer_reviews.title: Frustration only
customer_reviews.text: The small molded round edged plastic bones are impossible to pick up with the cheap tweezers included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just fun
customer_reviews.text: Throwback to childhood with this game. A lot of fun playing it again (I'm in my 50s lol) with a glass of wine and bzzz bzzz 😁
customer_reviews.author: Rick R.

customer_reviews.title: Classic Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those games that has lasted for years and grown into a classic. I got this for my 8 year old grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Hug1

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived damaged and game broken. Tried to post an honest, fair review and Amazon rejected it. Really?! Do not buy this game.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Hull

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great classic toy. My 6 and 4 year old love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still a great game, but the buzzer has gone soft
customer_reviews.text: Love the game. I bought this for my 6 year old girls. As a kid, I remember being excited/nerve wracked trying to avoid the loud obnoxious buzzer, it would almost startle you when it went off. This is partly why the game was so much fun! But the buzzer isn't the same—it sounds softer and less annoying. I miss the old buzzer!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Must be defective
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working shortly after we bought it. I’ve replaced the batteries but the game no longer vibrates.
customer_reviews.author: vwluvbg70

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: It came nicely packaged! No scratches and clean and also early! Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Devona M

customer_reviews.title: Classic!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I could find this old style game. It is not quite the classic because it includes brain freeze, but it is close enough.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered quick and in a new package, easy to learn and great for family fun!
customer_reviews.author: Liliana S. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Good game for the family. Came early and was packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Quality
customer_reviews.text: It's a nostalgic game, but I remember the construction was better quality or maybe it's just that I was a kid back then. The light buzzard and sound effect are pretty shabby (could be so much better). Great game to play once or twice, but there it is sitting in my game closet untouched. No further requests have been made to play it. It's either too difficult for the little ones, who become frustrated when their out after their first try or it becomes boring when the challenge is not taken seriously by the older players who give up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top Favorite game
customer_reviews.text: I remember playing this game as a child. It's so much fun playing together with my own child now.
customer_reviews.author: Speshal Joi

customer_reviews.title: Not so annoying.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't make that crazy annoying buzz you know so well from your childhood. Just a deep mild buzz. Not a bother when kids are hitting the sides like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: The real deal, just like I remember growing up. My 7 year old was challenged, but still enjoyed playing the classic version of Operation, my 4 year old had fun, but it was too difficult for him, my parents in their 70's enjoyed the game, as did my 40 year old self. Overall, nostalgic, fun & not too easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A classic must have
customer_reviews.text: This is a classic and an all time favorite among kids of all ages. Bought this to use when family came to visit during the holidays, all the kids had a blast playing the game at the kitchen table, kept the little one entertained for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Operation Electronic Board Game With Cards Kids Skill Game Ages 6 and Up (Amazon Exclusive)
product_meta.description:
Style:GameIn the Operation game, kids get to be the doctor and make Cavity Sam better or get the buzzer! Perform successful action noted on the cards by picking funny ailment pieces out of the game tray with a pair of tweezers. But watch out! If the tweezers touch the sides of the openings, the buzzer goes off and Cavity Sam's nose lights up! Then players look for their Specialist card that fits that action to earn an even higher fee. The player with the most money after all of the Funatomy parts have been removed wins the game! Hasbro Gaming and all related terms are trademarks of Hasbro.

AMAZON.COM
Surely countless medical careers have been launched because of this humorous game. The Operation game board features Sam the patient, lying atop a red plastic "operating table" with 12 body cavities exposed. Players perform highly skilled procedures with a pair of tweezers such as removing a broken heart or butterflies in the stomach. This kind of surgery requires a steady hand! Doctors must remove the offending body part without touching the metal lining of the cavity. Touch the metal edge, and you'll set off the buzzer and make Sam's nose light up. Then the designated Specialist steps in--for double the fee! If you're playing solo, try performing all 12 operations without getting zapped. Two AA batteries are required. Operation is for one or more players. --Elizabeth Ward

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Doctor, the patient is here to see you! And he's got a quite a few complaints, including a broken heart, water on the knee and butterflies in the stomach! Use all your skill and coordination to remove the patient's "ailments" with the tweezers - without setting off the buzzer and making the patient's nose light up! When that happens, it's time to call in a specialist!

REVIEW


For 1 or more players Includes game board with patient, body part tweezers, light bulb, and buzzer Instructions in English and Spanish Skills: fine motor coordination, strategy 2 D batteries required Supply is limited -- 

See more
feature_bullets: CHALLENGING AND FUN KIDS BOARD GAME: Players get to be "the doctor" and make Cavity Sam better or get the buzzer. Easy-grab ailment pieces and large openings help make gameplay fun for kids 6 and up
SKILL AND COORDINATION: Players use their skill and coordination to remove the patient's "ailments" with the tweezers. Collect the most money by successfully removing the Funatomy parts to win
INCLUDES DOCTOR CARDS AND SPECIALIST CARDS: Earn money if your removal of the Funatomy part didn't set off the buzzer. If it did, it's not a success and players get to use their Specialist card
CHILDHOOD MEMORIES: This Operation game with classic gameplay is similar to what many people remember from their childhood. Introduce a new generation to this silly, electronic board game for kids
FUN AND UNPREDICTABLE GAMEPLAY: The game features a surprising buzzer and a flashing nose when a player hits the sides with the tweezers
